definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: I heard a girl singing My Heart Will Go On when I passed the Music Hall.
sentences.chinese: 我經過音樂廳的時候聽到有個女孩唱《我心依舊》。

sentences.english: I'II meet you at the foyer of the Music Hall around seven.
sentences.chinese: 七點左右我在音樂廳休息處同你見面。

sentences.english: Mr. Shen Wenyu presented his piano recital at our Concert Hall on the afternoon of Nov. 16.
sentences.chinese: 沈文裕鋼琴獨奏音樂會今天下午在我院音樂廳舉行。

sentences.english: he built the Disney Concert Hall and he's like really famous and
sentences.chinese: 他建造了迪士尼音樂廳，他很有名。

sentences.english: After the concert the people flowed out of the hall.
sentences.chinese: 音樂會之後，人們從音樂廳裏湧出來。

sentences.english: The orchestra was already tuning up when we reached the concert hall.
sentences.chinese: 我們到達音樂廳時，樂隊已經調好音了。

sentences.english: There was a symphony concert at the Music Hall.
sentences.chinese: 在女王音樂廳有一個交響音樂會。

sentences.english: The semifinals were held on May 28 in Merkin Concert Hall.
sentences.chinese: 半決賽於五月二十八日在莫金音樂廳舉行。

sentences.english: The sound insulation equipment in the concert hall was imported from the us.
sentences.chinese: 音樂廳的隔音設備是從美國進口的。

sentences.english: Now what about the Odeon cafe. Four o'clock?
sentences.chinese: 四點，音樂廳的咖啡館好吧？

sentences.english: Ms. Yuan Sha and her students held a Guzheng concert at our Concert Hall tonight.
sentences.chinese: “袁莎古箏師生音樂會”今晚在學院音樂廳舉行。

sentences.english: A theatrical and concert complex with a separate organ hall.
sentences.chinese: 這是一座戲劇院和單獨配有風琴管的音樂廳。

sentences.english: The concert hall was packed to capacity with many people unable to get in.
sentences.chinese: 音樂廳已經滿座，還有很多人未能入場。

sentences.english: The conductor turned to face her audience and the entire concert hall fell silent.
sentences.chinese: 指揮轉身面對觀衆，整個音樂廳頓時鴉雀無聲。
卡奈基音樂廳，林肯中心。
